com.stormpath.sdk.group

Interface Group

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AccountStore, Auditable, Deletable, Extendable, Resource, Saveable

    public interface Group
extends Resource, Saveable, Deletable, AccountStore, Extendable, Auditable
    A group is a uniquely-named collection of Accounts within a Directory.
    Since:
    0.2

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GroupMembership addAccount(Account account)
      Assigns the specified Account to this Group.
      GroupMembership addAccount(String hrefOrEmailOrUsername)
      Assigns this Group to the specified Account represented by its (case insensitive) username, email or href

      Immediate Execution: Unlike other Group methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards.
      GroupMembershipList getAccountMemberships()
      Returns a paginated list of all of the memberships in which this group participates.
      AccountList getAccounts()
      Returns a paginated list of all accounts in the group.
      AccountList getAccounts(AccountCriteria criteria)
      Returns a paginated list of this group's accounts that match the specified query criteria.
      AccountList getAccounts(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
      Returns a paginated list of accounts in the group that match the specified query criteria.
      String getDescription()
      Returns the group's description.
      Directory getDirectory()
      Returns the group's parent Directory (where the group is stored).
      String getName()
      Returns the group's name, guaranteed to be unique for all groups within a Directory.
      GroupStatus getStatus()
      Returns the Group's status.
      Tenant getTenant()
      Returns the Stormpath Tenant that owns this Group resource.
      Group removeAccount(Account account)
      Removes this Group's association with the specified Account.
      Group removeAccount(String hrefOrEmailOrUsername)
      Removes this Group's association with the specified Account represented by its (case insensitive) username, email or href .
      Group saveWithResponseOptions(GroupOptions responseOptions)
      Saves this Group resource and ensures the returned Group response reflects the specified options.
      Group setDescription(String description)
      Sets the group's description.
      Group setName(String name)
      Sets the group's name, which must be unique among all other groups within a Directory.
      Group setStatus(GroupStatus status)
      Sets the Group's status.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the group's name, guaranteed to be unique for all groups within a Directory.
        Returns:
        the group's name, guaranteed to be unique for all groups within a Directory.

      • setName

        Group setName(String name)
        Sets the group's name, which must be unique among all other groups within a Directory.

        An attempt to set a name that is in use when creating or saving the group will result in a Error
        Parameters:
        name - the group's name, which must be unique among all other groups within a Directory.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Returns the group's description. This is an optional property and may be null or empty.
        Returns:
        the group's description. This is an optional property and may be null or empty.

      • setDescription

        Group setDescription(String description)
        Sets the group's description. This is an optional property and may be null or empty.
        Parameters:
        description - the group's description. This is an optional property and may be null or empty.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getStatus

        GroupStatus getStatus()
        Returns the Group's status. If a group is mapped to an Application as an Account Store (for login purposes), and the Group is disabled, the accounts within that Group cannot login to the application. Accounts in enabled Groups mapped to an Application may login to that application.
        Returns:
        the Group's status

      • setStatus

        Group setStatus(GroupStatus status)
        Sets the Group's status. If a group is mapped to an Application as an Account Store (for login purposes), and the Group is disabled, the accounts within that Group cannot login to the application. Accounts in enabled Groups mapped to an Application may login to that application.
        Parameters:
        status - the Group's status.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.

      • getTenant

        Tenant getTenant()
        Returns the Stormpath Tenant that owns this Group resource.
        Returns:
        the Stormpath Tenant that owns this Group resource.

      • getDirectory

        Directory getDirectory()
        Returns the group's parent Directory (where the group is stored).
        Returns:
        the group's parent Directory (where the group is stored)

      • getAccounts

        AccountList getAccounts()
        Returns a paginated list of all accounts in the group.

        Tip: If this list might be large, instead of iterating over all accounts, it might be more convenient (and practical) to execute a search for one or more of the group's accounts using the getAccounts(java.util.Map) method instead of this one.

        Returns:
        a paginated list of all accounts in the group.
        See Also:
        getAccounts(java.util.Map)

      • getAccounts

        AccountList getAccounts(Map<String,Object> queryParams)
        Returns a paginated list of accounts in the group that match the specified query criteria.

        Each queryParams key/value pair will be converted to String name to String value pairs and appended to the resource URL as query parameters, for example: 

         .../groups/groupId/accounts?param1=value1¶m2=value2&...
        Parameters:
        queryParams - the query parameters to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of accounts in the group that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • getAccounts

        AccountList getAccounts(AccountCriteria criteria)
        Returns a paginated list of this group's accounts that match the specified query criteria.

        The Accounts utility class is available to help construct the criteria DSL. For example: 

         group.list(Accounts
     .where(Accounts.description().containsIgnoreCase("foo"))
     .and(Accounts.name().startsWithIgnoreCase("bar"))
     .orderBySurname()
     .orderByGivenName().descending()
     .offsetBy(20)
     .limitTo(25));
        Parameters:
        criteria - the criteria to use when performing a request to the collection.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of accounts in the group that match the specified query criteria.
        Since:
        0.8

      • getAccountMemberships

        GroupMembershipList getAccountMemberships()
        Returns a paginated list of all of the memberships in which this group participates.
        Returns:
        a paginated list of all memberships in which this group participates.
        Since:
        0.8

      • addAccount

        GroupMembership addAccount(Account account)
        Assigns the specified Account to this Group.

        Immediate Execution: Unlike other Group methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards. This method will interact with the server immediately.

        Returns:
        the new GroupMembership resource created reflecting the group-to-account association.
        Since:
        0.4

      • addAccount

        GroupMembership addAccount(String hrefOrEmailOrUsername)
        Assigns this Group to the specified Account represented by its (case insensitive) username, email or href

        Immediate Execution: Unlike other Group methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards. This method will persist the changes in the backend immediately.

        Parameters:
        hrefOrEmailOrUsername - the href, email or username of the Account to associate.
        Returns:
        the new GroupMembership resource created reflecting the group-to-account association.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if no Account matching hrefOrEmailOrUsername could be found.
        Since:
        1.0.RC5

      • removeAccount

        Group removeAccount(Account account)
        Removes this Group's association with the specified Account.

        Immediate Execution: Unlike other Group methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards. This method will persist the changes in the backend immediately.

        Parameters:
        account - the Account object to disassociate.
        Returns:
        the Group object for method chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the specified Account does not belong to this Group.
        Since:
        1.0.RC5

      • removeAccount

        Group removeAccount(String hrefOrEmailOrUsername)
        Removes this Group's association with the specified Account represented by its (case insensitive) username, email or href .

        Immediate Execution: Unlike other Group methods, you do not need to call Saveable.save() afterwards. This method will persist the changes in the backend immediately.

        Parameters:
        hrefOrEmailOrUsername - the href, email or username of the Account to associate.
        Returns:
        the Group object for method chaining
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the obtained Account does not belong to this Group.
        Since:
        1.0.RC5

      • saveWithResponseOptions

        Group saveWithResponseOptions(GroupOptions responseOptions)
        Saves this Group resource and ensures the returned Group response reflects the specified options. This enhances performance by 'piggybacking' the response to return related resources you know you will use after saving the group.
        Parameters:
        responseOptions - The GroupOptions to use to customize the Group resource returned in the save response.
        Returns:
        this instance for method chaining.
        Since:
        0.9
